meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by apogamy.
meanings.sent1: The apogamous plant reproduced without the need for fertilization.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the apogamous species to understand their unique reproductive process.
meanings.sent3: The apogamous flowers seemed to have a secret trick up their petals.
meanings.sent4: Her apogamous nature made her stand out in a world full of traditional thinkers.
meanings.sent5: The apogamous trait of the organism fascinated the researchers with its efficiency.

meanings.sent1: The apogamous fish surprised the aquarium staff with its ability to reproduce on its own.
meanings.sent2: In some species, apogamous reproduction is a survival strategy in harsh environments.
meanings.sent3: The apogamous frogs threw a party to celebrate their independence from mates.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was apogamous, giving birth to ideas without external influence.
meanings.sent5: The apogamous ants built a thriving colony without the need for a queen.

meanings.definition: Not involving the formation of gametes.
meanings.sent1: The apogamous process bypassed the usual gamete formation stage.
meanings.sent2: Apogamous organisms have evolved unique ways to reproduce without gametes.
meanings.sent3: The apogamous experiment yielded unexpected results in the lab.
meanings.sent4: Her apogamous approach to problem-solving impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The apogamous strategy of the plant ensured its survival in challenging conditions.
